articles.headline: In Estonia, Caution but Surprising Cheers for Trump’s Victory
articles.snippet: Leaders in the country’s capital may be terrified, but on the Russian border people hope Donald J. Trump can lower tensions between Washington and Moscow.
articles.abstract: Leaders in the country’s capital may be terrified, but on the Russian border people hope Donald J. Trump can lower tensions between Washington and Moscow.
articles.lead_paragraph: NARVA, Estonia — Barely a few hundred yards inside NATO’s jittery eastern border with Russia, a high school teacher asked students in his social studies class this week to address a topic of paramount importance for their future: the election of Donald J. Trump as the next president of the United States.

articles.headline: For a Welsh City, the Tides Offer Renewal
articles.snippet: Swansea, once a hub of industrial activity, has fallen on harder times. A project to harness tides in the nearby bay offers a chance at rejuvenation.
articles.abstract: Swansea, once a hub of industrial activity, has fallen on harder times. A project to harness tides in the nearby bay offers a chance at rejuvenation.
articles.lead_paragraph: SWANSEA, Wales — From the brackish, brown water of the bay, Swansea’s past fortunes are plain to see.

articles.headline: Fake News in U.S. Election? Elsewhere, That’s Nothing New
articles.snippet: Social media’s political sway is a given in places like the Philippines, Indonesia and Colombia, where false news often emerges to influence the vote.
articles.abstract: Social media’s political sway is a given in places like the Philippines, Indonesia and Colombia, where false news often emerges to influence the vote.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Facebook rumors force a well-known politician to publish proof of his heritage. Fake images show a prominent female leader in a hangman’s noose. A politician’s aide decries violent crime with a Facebook photo of a girl’s corpse — an image that turns out to come from another country.
articles.byline: By Paul Mozur and Mark Scott

articles.headline: Michael Flynn, Anti-Islamist Ex-General, Offered Security Post, Trump Aide Says
articles.snippet: The move could put a retired intelligence officer who believes Islamist militancy poses an existential threat in one of the most powerful roles in shaping military and foreign policy.
articles.abstract: The move could put a retired intelligence officer who believes Islamist militancy poses an existential threat in one of the most powerful roles in shaping military and foreign policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Donald J. Trump has offered the post of national security adviser to Lt. Gen. Michael T. Flynn, potentially putting a retired intelligence officer who believes Islamist militancy poses an existential threat in one of the most powerful roles in shaping military and foreign policy, according to a top official on Mr. Trump’s transition team.
articles.byline: By Matthew Rosenberg and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: ‘There’s No Law on the Amazon’: River Pirates Terrorize Ships by Night
articles.snippet: As the population surges and drug gangs expand, hijacking opportunities along the Amazon have flourished, and police forces are struggling to keep up.
articles.abstract: As the population surges and drug gangs expand, hijacking opportunities along the Amazon have flourished, and police forces are struggling to keep up.
articles.lead_paragraph: MACAPÁ, Brazil — The pirates of the Amazon River relish striking after nightfall.

articles.headline: No Rest at Rest Home: Fighting Bias Against Gays and Lesbians
articles.snippet: If successful, Marsha Wetzel’s lawsuit against a senior living community in Illinois could set a legal precedent establishing housing providers’ responsibilities.
articles.abstract: If successful, Marsha Wetzel’s lawsuit against a senior living community in Illinois could set a legal precedent establishing housing providers’ responsibilities.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — IT wasn’t long after Marsha Wetzel moved in that the trouble started.

articles.headline: How to Save Money (and Hassles) on Your Black Friday Shopping
articles.snippet: Lower prices can be had by relying on a few innovative approaches without having to camp outside a big box store.
articles.abstract: Lower prices can be had by relying on a few innovative approaches without having to camp outside a big box store.
articles.lead_paragraph: If the idea of Black Friday shopping gives you the blues, cheer up.

articles.headline: Mike Pompeo, Sharp Critic of Hillary Clinton, Is Trump’s Pick to Lead C.I.A.
articles.snippet: Mr. Pompeo, a congressman from Kansas, gained prominence for his role in the House investigation into the 2012 attacks on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.
articles.abstract: Mr. Pompeo, a congressman from Kansas, gained prominence for his role in the House investigation into the 2012 attacks on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative Mike Pompeo was once pointedly asked why his committee’s inquiry into the 2012 attacks on the American diplomatic compound in Benghazi, Libya, had dragged on longer than the Watergate investigation. He did not flinch.
